* Ambati Rayudu, a former India batter, has withdrawn from the inaugural Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament in the USA due to personal reasons.
* Rayudu was signed by Texas Super Kings, a sister franchise of CSK, to play in the MLC.
* The MLC tournament is scheduled to take place in the USA from July 13 to 30.
* Several IPL franchisees, including KKR, CSK, and Mumbai Indians, own teams in the MLC competition.

* The Chennai Super Kings (CSK) are likely to acquire a stake in the Texas team, one of the six teams participating in the MLC tournament.
* The six teams competing in the tournament are San Francisco Unicorns, Los Angeles, New York, Seattle Orcas, Texas, and Washington D.C.
* The tournament is scheduled to begin on July 13 and will feature 19 matches over 18 days, with the final on July 30.
* Delhi Capitals, an IPL franchise, has partnered with Seattle Orcas to "help build and operate a world-class cricket team".
* Other IPL franchises, Kolkata Knight Riders and Mumbai Indians, are also involved with the Los Angeles and New York franchises, respectively.
* The MLC Domestic Player Draft is set to take place in Houston, with over 100 players eligible to represent the "USA cricket community" in the tournament.
* The remainder of each team's player roster will be filled with top T20 cricketers from around the globe.

* The first-ever MLC game in the US is set to take place on Thursday at Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas, with all 6,000 tickets sold out.
* The game will feature the Texas Super Kings, owned in part by Anurag Jain, against the Los Angeles Knight Riders, owned by Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan and Jay Mehta.
* The MLC has significant financial backing, with $120 million invested to expand its profile in America.
* The league has attracted top international cricketers, including Devon Conway, Dwayne Bravo, David Miller, Faf du Plessis, and Sunil Narine, who will play for the Texas Super Kings and Los Angeles Knight Riders.
* The MLC aims to bring top-level cricket to the US, with investors hoping to capitalize on the sport's global popularity, which ranks second only to soccer.
* The league plans to build a state-of-the-art cricket stadium in Los Angeles, designed by HKS, at a cost of $30 million.

* Australian captain Pat Cummins has been signed by the San Francisco Unicorns for the upcoming season of the MLC.
* The financial incentive is significant, with average players earning up to INR 2.5 crore for seven games and a couple of final matches.
* Cummins was attracted to the Unicorns due to the team's connections with prominent figures in the tech industry, including the CEOs of YouTube and Adobe, and the opportunity to explore Silicon Valley's innovative environment.
* The team's lead investors, Anand Rajaraman and Venky Harinarayan, are fans of Cummins and appreciate his tech-savviness and forward-thinking approach.
* Cummins' manager, Neil Maxwell, emphasized the learning aspect of the opportunity, which aligns with Cummins' post-cricket aspirations.
* Cricket Victoria, which supports the San Francisco Unicorns, played a role in facilitating the signing, while Cummins' home state, New South Wales, backs the Washington Freedom team in the MLC.

**Star Player Signing:** Pat Cummins, the Australian skipper, has been signed by San Francisco Unicorns for the upcoming season of the MLC.

**Player Earnings:** An average player in the MLC can earn up to INR 2.5 crore for seven matches and two finals, which is less than what Cummins earned (INR 1.8 crore per match) in the recent IPL season.

**Reason for Signing:** Cummins was attracted to the Unicorns due to their connection to Silicon Valley and the opportunity to learn about technology, which aligns with his interests.

**Team Investors:** The lead investors, Anand Rajaraman and Venky Harinarayan, are huge fans of Cummins and were willing to sign him due to his forward-thinking approach to technology and cricket.

**Cricket Victoria and NSW:** The Unicorns are supported by Cricket Victoria, while Cummins' home state of NSW supports Washington Freedom. The signing was only possible because it opens up opportunities for Cummins in Silicon Valley.

The Texas Super Kings team in the upcoming MLC season has suffered a setback with the injury of New Zealand all-rounder Daryl Mitchell, who has been ruled out of the tournament. Mitchell has been replaced by Afghan spinner Noor Ahmad, a 19-year-old left-arm wrist spinner with experience in T20 Internationals and franchise cricket. Despite Mitchell's absence, the Texas Super Kings have bolstered their squad with the signing of Australian all-rounder Marcus Stoinis, the No.1 ranked T20I all-rounder. The team, led by Faf du Plessis, will begin their campaign against the LA Knight Riders on July 6, with the MLC season running from July 6-29.

* The Major League Cricket (MLC) league has commended the national squad for reaching the Super 8 round.
